Participants.evidence: Conducted in a hospital setting, this case study involved a 77-year-old male with chronic kidney disease, type 1 diabetes mellitus, and hypertension

Intervention.evidence: a conservative management approach was adopted, involving high-risk staged percutaneous coronary intervention and dual antiplatelet therapy

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the management of a pulmonary valve mass suspicious of being a myxoma in a patient with multiple comorbidities.

Result_Outcome.evidence: At six months follow-up, the patient experienced no complications such as stroke or pulmonary embolism.

Harms.evidence: the patient experienced no complications such as stroke or pulmonary embolism.
